{{Quote|Who is Minecraft for? Everyone! Take a trip around the world with us as we meet Minecrafters from different walks of life.|author=Minecraft YouTube Channel<ref name=":0" />}}
'''''Meet a Minecrafter''''' is a series on the ''[[Minecraft]]'' YouTube channel that features interviews, experiences, and notable works in the ''Minecraft'' community.<ref name=":0">[https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZHdY_46KnYu3lyc5m1tdkCiRV2C9v498 Meet a Minecrafter - YouTube], April 1, 2025</ref>

Created in October 10, 2018, the [https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLZHdY_46KnYu3lyc5m1tdkCiRV2C9v498 series' playlist] currently counts with 26 videos.

|October 10th, 2018<ref name=":1">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VoVj7RXt8p4 Meet a Minecrafter: EyeMine] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 1.jpg|frameless]]
|Dr Mick Donegan, Ian Clements<ref name=":1" />
|Meet Dr Mick Donegan, CEO of Special Effect. Special Effect is a UK charity, levelling the playing field for gamers with disabilities. They have created EyeMine, a Windows-based software that helps people with severe disabilities play Minecraft – people like Ian Clements.<ref name=":1" />
|-
|November 7th, 2018<ref name=":2">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r1bwN8FwGrk Meet a Minecrafter: Patricia Romero! - YouTube] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 2.jpg|frameless]]
|Patricia Romea<ref name=":2" />
|Meet Patricia Romero – a teacher who used Minecraft in her own classroom in Mexico as part of ‘Coral Crafters’ – our project to help the world’s coral reefs! Patricia and her students were an integral part of Coral Crafters success. Here she talks about using Minecraft in the classroom and the Coral Crafters project.<ref name=":2" />
|-
|December 8th, 2018<ref name=":3">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dAbBDFkn8Qk Meet a Minecrafter: Immersive Minds' Refugee Crisis Map] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 3.jpg|frameless]]
|Stephen Reid<ref name=":3" />
|Meet Stephen Reid, founder of Immersive Minds. Immersive Minds believe in education through innovative use of tech, and have collaborated with teachers to produce a Minecraft map called 'The Refugee Crisis'. This map is used in schools and allow students to experience war – specifically, the aspect of having to flee for safety from the perspective of a family in the UK. It's a Minecraft adventure map with an educational purpose, designed to teach people about the harsh reality of life for a refugee.<ref name=":3" />
|-
|January 23rd, 2019<ref name=":4">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_T02h9z0TNM Meet a Minecrafter: Riku Kato visits Battleship Island, which he remade in Minecraft!] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 4.jpg|frameless]]
|Riku Kato<ref name=":4" />
|Riku Kato recreated a Japanese World Heritage Site called Battleship Island in a brilliant Minecraft map that you can find here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xx8UhJKq1H8&pp=0gcJCR0AztywvtLA. So we took him to Nagasaki to visit the real Battleship Island!<ref name=":4" />
|-
|March 11th, 2019<ref name=":5">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGnqnchKq3g Meet a Minecrafter: Cory Scheviak] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 5.jpg|frameless]]
|[[Cory Scheviak]]<ref name=":5" />
|Meet Minecraft developer Cory Scheviak! Originally from North Carolina, Cory created a Puerto Rico-inspired mod called Tropicraft, out of which came Love Tropics, a fundraiser generating thousands of dollars for the victims of Hurricane Maria. Cory now has his dream job at Mojang in Stockholm!<ref name=":5" />
|-
|April 12th, 2019<ref name=":6">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C_np9yDqd0E Meet a Minecrafter: Theatre Replacement] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 6.jpg|frameless]]
|Maiko Yamamoto, Hok<ref name=":6" />
|What do Beowulf, Bambi and the Terminator have in common? They all feature in "Mine", an experimental theatre show from Maiko Yamamoto and her son Hok which explores mother and son relationships through Minecraft!<ref name=":6" />
|-
|May 8th, 2019<ref name=":7">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8jMF0EE8nyg Meet a Minecrafter: SethBling] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 7.jpg|frameless]]
|[https://www.youtube.com/sethbling SethBling]<ref name=":7" />
|Welcome back, SethBling here. Playable guitars! Flushable toilets! The Atari 2600 (ask your parents!) SethBling has made them all work in Minecraft. But how does he do it? Is he a witch? Watch the video to find out! (Spoiler alert: he's not a witch. Probably.)<ref name=":7" />
|-
|June 18th, 2019<ref name=":8">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8xbnDMuFdQ0 Meet a Minecrafter: Prahlad & Josh Wulf] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 8.jpg|frameless]]
|Josh Wulf, Prahlad<ref name=":8" />
|When Prahlad Wulf got diagnosed with type 1 diabetes as an 8-year old, his father Josh wanted to find a way to support children and families living with it, as well as inform them on the challenges they face. Together, they came up with ‘Minecraft for Type 1 Diabetes’ , a Minecraft mod that gives kids the opportunity to experience how it is living with type 1 diabetes and teaches them the interaction of blood glucose, insulin, and carbs. <ref name=":8" />
|-
|July 26th, 2019<ref name=":9">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YzaStuZnHBc Meet a Minecrafter: Ph1LzA] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 9.jpg|frameless]]
|[https://www.youtube.com/user/Ph1LzA Ph1LzA]<ref name=":9" />
|How does it feel to survive playing Hardcore mode for five years, only to be taken down by a zombie? A BABY zombie, no less. Ph1LzA returns from the dead to give us the inside scoop on his approach to hardcore, surviving for so long and his streaming life after death!<ref name=":9" />
|-
|September 11th, 2019<ref name=":10">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=187gxxI5yLs Meet a Minecrafter: OMG Tech!] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 10.jpg|frameless]]
|OMGTech!<ref name=":10" />
|What do the Māori language (Te Reo Māori) and Creepers have in common? Well, they are both found in Minecraft! Thanks to the efforts of OMGTech!, who translated their “Hour of Code” Minecraft tutorial into Te Reo Māori and brought it to language-immersive schools.<ref name=":10" />
|-
|October 18th, 2019<ref name=":11">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=95BSKngD4mU Meet a Minecrafter: James Delaney & Blockworks] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 11.jpg|frameless]]
|James Delaney<ref name=":11" />
|James Delaney, one of the founders of Blockworks, speaks to us in Siena! Delaney talks us through his journey playing Minecraft, to founding Blockworks, and finally to becoming a member of the Block by Block board. Bravo!<ref name=":11" />
|-
|January 27th, 2020<ref name=":12">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G0LatTBuDaQ Meet a Minecrafter: Creating Chinese Cities] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 12.jpg|frameless]]
|Mr. Leopard, Qiandai, A'Liang<ref name=":12" />
|Always wanted to experience China’s ancient cities and rich heritage? You’re in luck! Meet the four passionate Minecrafters who’ve dedicated themselves to recreating many of their country’s breathtaking landmarks – for the whole world to experience!<ref name=":12" />
|-
|February 14th, 2020<ref name=":13">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OxpSnelt4kU Meet a Minecrafter: Ethiopian Park Project] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 13.jpg|frameless]]
|Aklilu Fikresilassie, Almaz Mekonnen Zeray<ref name=":13" />
|There are countless ways to play Minecraft, but this neighborhood in Addis Ababa chose to use it as a tool instead. Watch how an entire community comes together to turn a polluted area into a new park!<ref name=":13" />
|-
|March 13th, 2020<ref name=":14">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KgUiJFwhM2I Meet a Minecrafter: Janey Laney] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 14.jpg|frameless]]
|Janey Laney<ref name=":14" />
|Are those bee suits as soft as they look? Minecraft streamer Janey Laney was lucky enough to find out at last year’s MINECON! We sat down to talk all about bee dances, positive role models and bringing cultures together through the power of Minecraft.<ref name=":14" />
|-
|April 10th, 2020<ref name=":15">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L_ok4s6Y1LE Meet a Minecrafter: Jacob Hashimoto] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 15.jpg|frameless]]
|Jacob Hashimoto<ref name=":15" />
|Meet Jacob Hashimoto, an artist who creates beautiful room-sized sculptures inspired by Minecraft. Jacob reflects on the value that long play sessions of Minecraft can have, both on the art world and on young minds overall. So if you were looking for an excuse to spend hours and hours on a build, look no further!<ref name=":15" />
|-
|May 16th, 2020<ref name=":16">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ItMomtypFs Meet a Minecrafter: Urban Girls Movement] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 16.jpg|frameless]]
|Moné Ukonu<ref name=":16" />
|The Urban Girls Movement helps girls find improvements for their neighborhoods by building them in Minecraft before bringing them to life in the real world. Does that include Creepers? There’s only one way to find out!<ref name=":16" />
|-
|June 13th, 2020<ref name=":17">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SZ7ZxEECwp0 Meet a Minecrafter: MoPOP] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 17.jpg|frameless]]
|Brooks Peck, Jacob McMurray, Kwapi Vengesayi, Rosie Alyea, Martin Christoffel<ref name=":17" />
|Have you ever wanted to step into your Minecraft world? Of course you have! Thanks to the Minecraft Exhibit at the Museum of Pop Culture in Seattle, visitors can punch trees for wood, use a working crafting table, and avoid real skeletons. They didn’t mention Creepers, so proceed with caution! If you want to experience it for yourself, keep an eye on http://www.mopop.org/minecraft for updates on the exhibit’s reopening and tour!<ref name=":17" />
|-
|July 10th, 2020<ref name=":18">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4PkzGNeAAeA Meet a Minecrafter: Artificial Intelligence (Part 1)] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 18.jpg|frameless]]
|Katja Hofmann, Will Guss<ref name=":18" />
|In this first of our two-part series on Minecraft and Artificial Intelligence, Katja Hofmann (Microsoft Research) and Will Guss (OpenAI and Carnegie Mellon University) talk about how they are using Minecraft to push the boundaries of AI research, and how lava might one day help a house-cleaning robot know where your carpet is.<ref name=":18" />
|-
|August 14th, 2020<ref name=":19">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v0prAZhW2wM Meet a Minecrafter: Artificial Intelligence (Part 2)] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 19.jpg|frameless]]
|Kavya Srinet, Arthur Szlam<ref name=":19" />
|In the second half of our Minecraft and Artificial Intelligence series, the Facebook AI Research team describe their Craft Assist project and how Minecraft is helping them study the way humans can interact with computers using natural language.<ref name=":19" />
|-
|September 10th, 2020<ref name=":20">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ToWAdmRKvLQ Meet a Minecrafter: Autcraft] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 20.jpg|frameless]]
|Stuart Duncan<ref name=":20" />
|When Stuart Duncan (a.k.a. AutismFather) realized that kids with autism were getting bullied, he started Autcraft <nowiki>https://www.autcraft.com/</nowiki>. His server is a sanctuary for members of the Autistic community – a safe space where they can play, craft, and communicate without fear. <ref name=":20" />
|-
|November 20th, 2020<ref name=":21">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fgqp_H7j0KI Meet a Minecrafter: Woodes] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 21.jpg|frameless]]
|[[w:Woodes|Woodes]]<ref name=":21" />
|Join Woodes for her debut album launch in Minecraft! Together with her  @Woodes Music  community and videographer Reuben Gore, the Australian artist has created an immersive experience for her fans. The Crystal Ball world is a musical museum where you can walk from song to song, find hidden lyrics, and of course, dance the night away. <ref name=":21" />
|-
|December 18th, 2020<ref name=":22">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7x0ZOB5UoSw Meet a Minecrafter: Blind Minecraft] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 22.jpg|frameless]]
|Christopher O'Meally<ref name=":22" />
|In this edition of Meet a Minecrafter, we explore the world of Blind Minecraft. Join Chris (aka Logic Pro X Gaming) to learn how sound and text-to-speech make it possible for blind players to play Minecraft, and how zombies flipped the script by saving his life!<ref name=":22" />
|-
|April 9th, 2021<ref name=":26">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9K1q4NXe0hs Meet a Minecrafter: Grandparent Gamers ft Bacon Mom] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 23.jpg|frameless]]
|Bacon_Mom<ref name=":26" />
|Meet Bacon_Mom. Artist. Grandmother. Minecrafter. Together with her grandchildren and the Minecraft community, she creates beautiful art that doesn’t leave any mess that needs cleaning up. We also check in with Jeff, a professor of Communications & Creative Media who walks us through the different aspects of picking up video games in a later age.<ref name=":26" />
|-
|January 28th, 2022<ref name=":23">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qpc7kN4gBEo First Minecraft Trailer Mystery – Solved!! (ft Dennis Vareide)] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 24.jpg|frameless]]
|Dennis Vareide<ref name=":23" />
|There are many mysteries waiting for you in Minecraft 1.19, but they pale in comparison to the ones that surround the official Minecraft trailer. Did a fan trailer really turn the creator into a movie star? And what happened to that guy, didn’t he die? Dennis Vareide is here to answer these questions and disprove the conspiracy theory of his death. Because as you can see, he is very much alive!<ref name=":23" />
|-
|April 8th, 2023<ref name=":24">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zktZGd2uVVg From Minecraft To Reality - Meet A Minecrafter] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 25.jpg|frameless]]
|Nora Pulido Montealegre, Gabriel García Rodríguez<ref name=":24" />
|Discover the story of how a Minecraft build led to the restoration of a real-life historical building!  Meet Nora and Gabriel, who work on the dissemination of cultural heritage and history through Minecraft. Combining architecture, history, and education with Minecraft, Gabriel creates replicas of buildings of cultural and historical significance in the game, which they work together to promote on social media. Find out how their work has led to the restoration of the church of Santiago Apóstol de Villamorón! <ref name=":24" />
|-
|November 4th, 2023<ref name=":25">[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4SJPdXH89ow From Blocks to Bricks: Crafting Our Town's Future] Minecraft on YouTube, April 2, 2025</ref>
|[[File:Meet a Minecrafter 26.jpg|frameless]]
|José Manuel Salado Fernández<ref name=":25" />
|José Manuel Salado Fernández has been playing Minecraft since the very beginning. Alongside his fellow colleagues, he teaches children about their potential to change their environment. Watch as they venture into the small towns of Malaga, Spain, to brainstorm ideas for enhancing the lives of its residents – then visualize it using Minecraft!<ref name=":25" />
|}
